channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2023070862
item.description:
Report X-2023070862

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was located in the hazmat cage and once inspected, one bottle inside the package had a loose cap and leakage of the product. Upon further inspection the bottle was about 3/4 full, but only about 3oz leaked out. DescribePack: The bottle cap closure was loose and the inside liquid contents leaked inside the package. DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: Hazmats were immediately seperated and brought to the hazmat cage (appropriate location) to be handled safely.

item.title: Report E-2023070344
item.description:
Report E-2023070344

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading a pallet of lab pack containers onto a trailer at the Veolia 10 day intransit facility in Dayton, OH, a Veolia operator noticed an odor coming from the pallet. Initially, the employee did not see any damaged or wet boxes, so he proceeded to break down the pallet to inspect each box. After breaking down the pallet, a wet Questar box (141G) was discovered. Veolia estimates approximately one quart of liquid was released during the spill, most of which was absorbed by the fiber box. It appears that a bottle of allyl bromide broke in transit leading to the saturation of the box and release of liquid. The small amount of liquid that was released outside of the fiber box remained on the pallet under the box. The leaking box and spill pads used to clean up the spill were overpacked together for continued transportation to the final disposal facility.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER SPILLAGE

item.title: Report X-2023070602
item.description:
Report X-2023070602

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazardous material drum was inspected and processed by the QA team. It was then put onto a tugger cart to be taken to a trailer to be loaded. When the bucket was placed on to the tugger cart and started travelling, the liquid inside of the drum started to leak out of the top seal. When the tugger operator reached the load end, he notified management. The liquid got on the tugger cart and on the outside of the drum. No physical contact was made with the liquid by any employees. DescribePack: The lid to the drum did not fit correctly or was improperly sealed. No visible damage to the cap/outer container was found. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The drum was immediately set on to a flat stable surface away from the operation to prevent any further spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023070328
item.description:
Report E-2023070328

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 28, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of organic peroxide leaked approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior due to a faulty lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surface. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged lid were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L. FCE personnel replaced the lid on the 330-gallon tote.

item.title: Report E-2023070183
item.description:
Report E-2023070183

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 20, 2023, one (1) 6-gallon pail of Rhino Brite was damaged and released one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the damaged pail and contained it in one (1) 55-gallon drum. ES neautrailzed the free standing product and deployed absorbents. All impacted absorbents were contained in a separate 55-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the poly 5 gallon cans of X-cide (un2922) releasing 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070150
item.description:
Report E-2023070150

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 16, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of disinfectant was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt below. R+L Carriers retianed Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. he drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum for disposal. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The undamaged cargo was wiped down and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All UN1903 impacted materials and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 35-gallon drums for disposal. The drums were properly labeled, and possession of the material was taken by RLC to be disposed of through their bulk waste stream.
